intro: Lobivia charcasina, commonly known as the Charcasina lobivia, is a species of cactus native to the Andean regions of Bolivia and Peru. It is characterized by its compact, globular shape and dense covering of white to pale blue spines. The plant produces yellow flowers during the spring and summer months, which are typically short-lived but striking in appearance. Lobivia charcasina is well adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, storing water in its thick, fleshy stems. It is a popular choice among cactus enthusiasts due to its ornamental value and relatively low maintenance requirements.
